member.summary: Zoom and pans the diagram in such a way that all items will fit into the currently visible area of the canvas. If there are no items or the visible area is with empty size or the margin is greater than the visible area no action will be performed.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadDiagram.FitTo(System.Windows.Rect,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the viewport to the provided rectangle.
member.param: The new viewport. If the viewport is invalid (NaN or infinity for position or size) the operation will not be executed. The desired zoom level after the bring operation is determined by the ratio of new viewport width to current viewport width. The zoom will be coerced according to property restriction.
Determines whether an animation will be used.
member.returns: Whether the operation has bee executed successfully or not.

member.returns: Whether the operation has bee executed successfully or not.

member.summary: Pans the diagram to the provided position. The values are interpreted in the zoomed coorditnate system. This means that panning with 100px will result in visual translation with 100px.

The new position on Y axis.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadDiagram.ZoomInternal(System.Double,System.Windows.Point,Telerik.Windows.Controls.Diagrams.ZoomType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms the diagram. With incremental zoom the difference between current zoom and new zoom will be applied in the new zoom center. This way the new zoom values will be accumulated to the previous once. With non incremental zoom (absolute) the new zoom and zoom point will clear the old zoom values.
member.param: The point where new zoom should be applied. The point should be provided in original coordinates.
Determines whether animation should be used.

member.summary: Creates a two arrows one after another from the specified points.
member.param: The start points - the tip of the arrow.

The points of the double arrow: Point1 : the left arrow head point of the first arrow. Point2 : the base arrow point of the first arrow. Point3 : the left arrow head point of the second arrow. If set to true the arrow will be closed.
If set to true the arrow's head will be filled.
member.returns: Returns a figure of a double arrow.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Diagrams.RadDiagramItem.AddDragInitializeHandler
member.summary: These two methods are used to fix an issue in Silverlight related to the IsMouseOver property when DragDrop operation is in progress. When drag is started from a DragDrop enabled control inside the shape, leaving the shape (with mouse) while dragging will not fire the MouseLeave event (hence the IsMouseOver will stay to true) because of the mouse capture. Thus we listen for DragInitialize event and set our IsMouseOver property to false when drag operation has been started by a component anywhere inside the item.
